channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Business Process Manager
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Business Process Manager

item.title: CVE-2017-1767|2024-09-17T00:37:06.602Z -- ibm -- business%20process%20manager
item.description: IBM Business Process Manager 8.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 136152.

item.title: CVE-2017-1756|2024-09-17T01:31:39.318Z -- ibm -- business%20process%20manager
item.description: IBM Business Process Manager 8.6 allows web pages to be stored locally which can be read by another user on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 135856.

item.title: CVE-2020-4530|2024-09-17T01:01:53.594Z -- ibm -- business%20process%20manager
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow C.D.0 and IBM Business Process Manager 8.0, 8.5, and 8.6 are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-ForceID: 182714.

item.title: CVE-2020-4557|2024-09-17T00:16:08.878Z -- ibm -- business%20process%20manager
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow 18.0, 19.0, and 20.0 and IBM Business Process Manager 8.5 and 8.6 are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 183611.

item.title: CVE-2020-4698|2024-09-17T00:42:27.615Z -- ibm -- business%20process%20manager
item.description: IBM Business Process Manager 8.5, 8.6 and IBM Business Automation Workflow 18.0, 19.0, and 20.0 are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 186841.
